text: live updates for herefordshire and worcestershire have finished for the day - we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday with more live news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: one-way system removed over christmas
text: a one-way system is being removed from a hereford city centre street for a month during christmas and new year .
part of widemarsh street has been one way since october while the new city link road is built , but it 'll be open as normal between 9 december and 4 january .
the traffic restrictions will return in the new year - for eight more weeks .

documents.title: more than 400 cases of hiv diagnosed in the west midlands last year
text: the number of new cases of hiv in the west midlands rose by 10 % in 2015 - with 473 people newly diagnosed .
thirty eight of those diagnosed had left it so late to go to the doctor they were diagnosed with aids .
public health england says the rise is worrying and reinforces the importance of safe sex .
there are more than 6,000 people being treated for hiv in the region .
news dispels the myths of hiv to mark thursday 's world aids day .

documents.title: coming up on midlands today : call for stronger drink drive penalties
text: a man whose mother was killed by a drunk driver has called for tougher penalties for people who drink and drive .
one regional police force is also using a simulator as part of this year 's drink drive crackdown .
we 'll have more on bbc one from 18:30 .
author: Bob Hockenhull
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: date for fire station transfer announced
text: the fire service is preparing to bid farewell to the fire station in merstow green , evesham and make the move to their shiny new home .
the current station is 50 years old .
crews will be transferring to the new fire station off abbey road on monday 12 december at 09:00 .

documents.title: more than 40 jobs lost as kidderminster firm collapses
text: dozens of staff from a historic kidderminster car part manufacturing firm have lost their jobs just weeks before christmas after the company plunged into administration .

documents.title: rugby : wasps 'hard-hit ' by injuries heading into worcester derby
text: wasps are hard-hit by injuries as they prepare to take on worcester warriors this weekend .
they are without a total of 15 players , including nathan hughes , who starts at number eight for england at twickenham .
the absentees also include the suspended elliot daly and lock joe launchbury ( who remains with the england camp .

wasps , four points off top spot , have won the past four premiership games between the two sides , since a 29-23 win for the warriors at sixways in march 2013 - which was prior to this fixture becoming a midlands derby .
author: Ged Scott
BBC Sport

documents.title: cctv images released after mobility pedal tricycle stolen
text: cctv images of two men police would like to speak to after a mobility pedal tricycle was stolen have been released .
west mercia police say the tricycle was stolen from outside a shop on hawthorn road , worcester between 23:20 on sunday and 09:20 on monday .

documents.title: civil war in worcester : some more landmarks part three
text: musket balls uncovered by a metal detectorist in the teme valley have revealed the location of an encampment from the engilsh civil war .
the house from which king charles ii escaped after losing the battle still stands - it 's now a restaurant .
the house originally stood right next to the city 's defensive walls .
most of the walls are long gone , but sections remain nearby .

documents.title: civil war in worcester : some more landmarks part two
text: a metal detectorist has found evidence of an english civil war encampment in the teme valley - but that 's not the only site in worcestershire connected to the conflict .
fort royal in worcester was a key battery of guns overlooking the city , that was held by troops loyal the king charles ii .
the city fell shortly after the new model army took it at the end of the battle of worcester on 3 september 1651- it 's now a park .
the king watched the battle unfold from the top of the tower of worcester cathedral .
the commandery , now a museum to the english civil war , was a hospital during the battle .

documents.title: could the smart hard shoulder lanes become smarter ?
text: more emergency refuge areas could be added to motorways around the midlands where hard shoulders have been converted into traffic lanes .
the smart motorway programme 's been criticised by some because of a lack of places to stop .
now highways england is looking again at whether more lay-bys are needed in the `` breakdown hot spots '' .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: civil war in worcester : some more landmarks part one
text: evidence of an english civil war encampment has been in the teme valley by a metal detector , who found musket balls at the site .
the first significant cavalry clash of the conflict took place at powick bridge just outside worcester on 23 september 1642 - the bridge is still there .
the famous `` pepperpot '' tower of the old church in upton still bears the scars from musket balls fired after parliamentary forces crossed the bridge 28 august 1651 .

documents.title: new road flood protection plans : scheme will 'keep road open for longer '
text: a scheme to raise the carriageway and footpath in new road in worcester will `` keep the road open for longer '' , according to the project officer .
the road is regularly flooded by the nearby river severn - in the floods of february last year , shuttle buses had to run along it to get people from one side of the city to the other .
detailed plans for the scheme have gone on show at the hive from today .

while we can never predict how much water there will be , this scheme will keep the road open for longer during flooding and it will alleviate some of the problems faced by people trying to get in and out of the city .
we are aiming to keep people moving without the need for the shuttle buses that we 've had to use in the past and to ensure that worcester stays open for business . ''

documents.title: evidence of english civil war encampment discovered
text: evidence of an english civil war encampment has been found in the teme valley , by an metal detectorist .
a large number of musket balls are being plotted and because they have all been discovered in the same place , it is believed they were part of a temporary store .

peter reavill , the finds liason officer for shropshire said it was likely to have been a muster point , where bodies of soldiers gathered and said there was also evidence of a small-scale siege a few miles away , near cleobury mortimer .
and while he said the discovery of the musket balls `` is n't sexy '' , it revealed what he described as an unrecorded `` hidden history '' .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : edgar street pitch `` in good condition ''
text: a local referee has carried out a `` precautionary pitch inspection '' this morning at edgar street , and has ruled it is `` in good condition following the recent cold weather '' , the club says .
the bulls have a home game against salisbury tomorrow - full coverage on bbc hereford & worcester .
the forecast remains good , the club says , with temperatures predicted to stay above freezing .
however , the pitch will be covered in places today as `` a precautionary measure '' .
hereford fc say a local referee will once again take a look at the pitch first thing tomorrow morning to ensure it remains in a playable condition .

documents.title: if you think it was cold earlier this week
text: there may have been a cold snap earlier this week , but at least the river did n't freeze .
the worcestershire archive and archaeology service has been looking back to 1895 , when the river severn froze at bewdley .

documents.title: free food for swans over christmas
text: an animal welfare group is offering free swan pellets to allow the public to feed the colony living in the centre of worcester over the christmas period .
the swan food project will be giving away a whole sack of floating swan pellets to members of the public on 16 , 28 , 30 of december , and on new year 's day .

documents.title: council and police aim to cut out 'growing issue ' of fly-tipping
text: fly-tippers will be hit hard in a police crackdown after council chiefs admitted almost 2,000 fly-tips in the last 12 months have left them facing a `` growing issue '' .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: swimming pool closed after broken glass found
text: the main pool at the abbey stadium in redditch has had to be closed and drained for a `` deep clean '' after broken glass was found .
redditch borough council said there were no swimmers present and no one was injured as glass in a poolside door broke and fell into the stadium 's main pool .

the council says pool workers must now drain over 600,000 litres of water from both the main and learner pools , before cleaning the pools and their systems - they will the be refilled and reheated to the right temperature .
it 's not currently clear how long the process will take , but `` it could be several days '' .
an investigation is under way , the council says .

documents.title: five arrested for immigration offences and sus of money laundering
text: five people have been arrested following an operation to target immigration , drugs and firearms offences , police say .
west mercia police , working with the national crime agency ( nca ) and the uk border agency ( ukba ) , raided at four addresses in evesham and another in stourbridge on monday .
two people arrested on sus of money laundering and immigration offences will face no further police action , though one of them is being dealt with by the immigration authority , a spokesman said .
a 38-year-old man , arrested on sus of money laundering and drugs offences , has been released on police bail until january .
the fifth person arrested is still in custody `` where he will be questioned today '' , police say .

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : syrian settlers move to thank residents
text: on midlands today this lunchtime - as the battles continues in syria , refugees from the war there are planning a special dinner to thank people who 've helped them start new lives here .
one city in our region has had more syrians settle in their area than any other uk city - now , some of those who 've benefited want to say thanks .
we 'll have the full story from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: new road flood protection plans : road and footpaths to be raised
text: a scheme to cut the number of times new road in worcester is flooded will involved raising the road and the footpaths .
detailed plans of the scheme are on show at the hive in worcester from today .
the road , which runs along one side of worcestershire county cricket ground , is regularly flooded by the river severn and flood water `` backing up '' from the river teme .

documents.title: basketball : 'light at the end of the tunnel ' says wolves coach
text: worcester wolves director of basketball , paul james , says he can `` see the light at the end of the tunnel '' now they are nearly back at full strength .
recent signing maurice walker ( starred as wolves beat leeds in their last game , to win for the first time in the bbl since october .
wolves are back in action tonight as they take on bottom club bristol flyers at the university arena - tip-off is at 19:30 , and the action will be live on the bbc sport website .

documents.title: bulls look to sign another defender
text: the hereford fc manager pete beadle says the club want to sign another defender to replace adam davies .
davies left edgar street this week to return to merthyr town only a couple of months after joining the bulls .

documents.title: plans to cut flooding on a major worcester road go on display
text: the plans for a scheme to reduce the risk of flooding on worcester 's new road will be on display at the hive from today .
the exhibition will show how the road and footways will be raised to reduce the likelihood of them being closed by flood water in the future .
if the planning application is successful , work will start in the autumn next year .
